content: The Tamil Tigers had midget submarines?!!!! So this is yet more evidence that the LTTE is fighting a more of a conventional campaign against the Sri Lanka government than as an insurgency, aside from the fact that the LTTE have their own air element as well. quote: Sri Lankan Defence Ministry on January 29, shows troops inspecting a submarine-type craft Fri Jan 30, 3:28 AM ET This undated photograph released by the Sri Lankan Defence Ministry on January 29, shows troops inspecting a submarine-type craft developed by the Tamil Tiger rebels in the northeastern village of Udayarkattu. Sri Lanka troops said Thursday they found a submarine-type craft and three other boats that could have been used in suicide attacks during searches in the district of Mullaittivu. (AFP/HO/Ho) quote: Source: "http://www.defpro.com/news/details/5242/" 11:40 GMT, February 2, 2009 defpro.com - Mullaittivu | Sri Lanka Army Task Force 3 found an LTTE (Liberation Tigers of Tamil Eelam commonly also known as the Tamil Tigers) underwater vehicle along with 3 other smaller underwater vehicles which are still under construction from the Udayarkattukulam area in Mullaittivu on January 28. Military sources said that this was the most startling recovery made by troops so far during the ongoing counter terrorist operations against the LTTE. Three suicide boats and a large haul of LTTE maritime equipment were also found at the location, the sources added. The sources further revealed, the largest underwater vehicle found is about 35 feet in length and amour plated. Among the other items found , there were one low bed trailer, one armour plate used for bending machines, fifteen oxy-acetylene welding cylinders, thirty armour plate sheets of 20 ft each, three pedal-type suicide boats, one Dvora-type fast attack craft, a large number of water pumps, two lorries, two buses, one truck, one heavy duty generator, one water bowzer trailer, one bowzer, filled with kerosene, two large lathe machines, two powerful compressors, one welding plant, a number of electric motors, one large lifting jack, many boats and vehicle engines, three hangar-shaped buildings of 75 ft x 15 ft each, fifteen small tiled-houses of 20 ft x 30 ft with full air conditioning and five tiled-billets of 25 ft x 100 ft with full air conditioning. With this discovery the LTTE will go down in the history as the first terrorist organization to develop underwater weapons. Also, the LTTE is the first terrorist outfit to introduce suicide bombers to the world and to develop naval and air arms... (...) (pictures from official Sri Lanakan Army website)
quote: Sri Lankan Defence Ministry on January 29, shows troops inspecting a submarine-type craft Fri Jan 30, 3:28 AM ET This undated photograph released by the Sri Lankan Defence Ministry on January 29, shows troops inspecting a submarine-type craft developed by the Tamil Tiger rebels in the northeastern village of Udayarkattu. Sri Lanka troops said Thursday they found a submarine-type craft and three other boats that could have been used in suicide attacks during searches in the district of Mullaittivu. (AFP/HO/Ho)

Military sources said that this was the most startling recovery made by troops so far during the ongoing counter terrorist operations against the LTTE. Three suicide boats and a large haul of LTTE maritime equipment were also found at the location, the sources added. The sources further revealed, the largest underwater vehicle found is about 35 feet in length and amour plated. Among the other items found , there were one low bed trailer, one armour plate used for bending machines, fifteen oxy-acetylene welding cylinders, thirty armour plate sheets of 20 ft each, three pedal-type suicide boats, one Dvora-type fast attack craft, a large number of water pumps, two lorries, two buses, one truck, one heavy duty generator, one water bowzer trailer, one bowzer, filled with kerosene, two large lathe machines, two powerful compressors, one welding plant, a number of electric motors, one large lifting jack, many boats and vehicle engines, three hangar-shaped buildings of 75 ft x 15 ft each, fifteen small tiled-houses of 20 ft x 30 ft with full air conditioning and five tiled-billets of 25 ft x 100 ft with full air conditioning. With this discovery the LTTE will go down in the history as the first terrorist organization to develop underwater weapons. Also, the LTTE is the first terrorist outfit to introduce suicide bombers to the world and to develop naval and air arms... (...) (pictures from official Sri Lanakan Army website)

content: quote: Originally posted by PanzerMeister: Well, LTTE were not the first to introduce suicide bombers IMHO. Commie Terrorists in the 19 century in Russia have been first. Wiki says that Samson, a Hebrew, is the first recorded suicide attacker. He pulled a Palestinian temple down on top of all inside, including himself. Lacking modern delivery systems, no doubt Israeli freedom fighters would be using explosives with human guidance systems, too. The suicide thing, however, is totally outside the pale for its irrationality. "He who bombs and runs away, lives to bomb another day". Nu?

content: Samson is a mythical figure, and i doubt that he has ever existed. "Lacking modern delivery systems, no doubt Israeli freedom fighters would be using explosives with human guidance systems, too." I seriously doubt it. Irgun members have planted the bombs and not exploded themselves in the process. Suicide bombings are the tool of the incompetent idiots or someone that has a death wish. Much better to plant the bomb and get out from the scene in order to fight another day. However when you seek your virgins or death as Hamas/LTTE do, you do blow yourself up.

content: quote: Samson is a mythical figure, and i doubt that he has ever existed. Since many "stories" in the Bible have been proven to be of some actual historical value, it is illogical to state Samason was mythical. True, many of the dubious atributes he is said to possess are quite likely streched (a lot), like all verbal history is, no one can say with certainty that the person never existed. Unless, of course, you want to discount the physical being of every historical person, just because everyone doesn't 'believe' the source in which their accounts are written....
quote: Samson is a mythical figure, and i doubt that he has ever existed.

content: quote: Originally posted by fmfdoc451: quote: Samson is a mythical figure, and i doubt that he has ever existed. Since many "stories" in the Bible have been proven to be of some actual historical value, it is illogical to state Samason was mythical. True, many of the dubious atributes he is said to possess are quite likely streched (a lot), like all verbal history is, no one can say with certainty that the person never existed. Unless, of course, you want to discount the physical being of every historical person, just because everyone doesn't 'believe' the source in which their accounts are written.... However many stories have not yet had any factual evidence or historic proof attached to them... so assuming that something is true based on another part of the book being partially true is silly. That's like thinking spider-man is real just because lives in NY and was in a comic with POTUS. Sri Lanka is having a rough week of things.

content: Oddly enough these rather Heath Robinson affairs reminded me that you lot might actually have a claim on inventing the midget submarine. IIRC one was invented (the Turtle?) while you were being revolting back in the 1770s to attack RN warships in New York harbour. I wonder if these Tamil confections were any more effective?
reply: Oddly enough these rather Heath Robinson affairs reminded me that you lot might actually have a claim on inventing the midget submarine. content: quote: Originally posted by Bladensburg: Oddly enough these rather Heath Robinson affairs reminded me that you lot might actually have a claim on inventing the midget submarine. IIRC one was invented (the Turtle?) while you were being revolting back in the 1770s to attack RN warships in New York harbour. I wonder if these Tamil confections were any more effective? I think you are correct on the history. And if I can recall correctly, the name of the RN warship sunk by Turtle was called HMS Eagle and the ensuing explosion also destroyed Turtle as well. Still, when I think of these Tamil Tiger submarines, I think more of those WW2-era Imperial Japanese Navy manned suicide torpedoes or Kaiten, one of which sank the oiler USS Mississinewa in Ulithi atoll in Nov.1944, IIRC.

Still, when I think of these Tamil Tiger submarines, I think more of those WW2-era Imperial Japanese Navy manned suicide torpedoes or Kaiten, one of which sank the oiler USS Mississinewa in Ulithi atoll in Nov.1944, IIRC.
title: Tamil Tiger submarines discovered by Sri Lankan troops

content: I don't think Eagle was sunk, damaged possibly but according to Wiki (pinch of salt perhaps) she was in action off India in 1883 and not broken up until 1812. The time of her breaking up is odd, she was a Third Rate 64 and they were quite often cut down to make big ~40 gun frigates which is what the RN was discovering it needed more of in 1812.
reply: I don't think Eagle was sunk, damaged possibly but according to Wiki (pinch of salt perhaps) she was in action off India in 1883 and not broken up until 1812. The time of her breaking up is odd, she was a Third Rate 64 and they were quite often cut down to make big ~40 gun frigates which is what the RN was discovering it needed more of in 1812.
